intro: Eriogonum temblorense, commonly known as the trembling bursage, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Eriogonum temblorense plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
